page.title: 03CHADWELL ST. MARY
page.content: At the top of Chadwell Hill stands the crossroads with the church at one corner and a modern library made of wood,brick and much glass at the opposite corner.Across the road is{The {Crosskeys}:a public house which has become a local landmark and gives its name to the crossroads;and on the final corner stands {Sleepers Farm},a cottage with a thatched roof which was built for Daniel{Defoe. The rest of Chadwell is a mix of different{housing.}Among the rather dowdy older properties are two tower blocks of flats,many late 50's council houses in good repair,and some modern town houses.There is one weirdly-shaped building: it looks roughly hexagonal.There is also a cemetery serving both Chadwell and Tilbury.
